thread.section_title: AllAfrica News: Economy, Business and Finance
thread.title: Kenya: Sweet Deal for Investors

title: Kenya: Sweet Deal for Investors
text:
Cumulatively, the factories have a debt of Sh59 billion, which renders them unattractive to potential investors. 
Drastic measures must be taken to save the industry. 
The government is not very good at running business and must hand over to private enterprise. 
However, care must be taken so that privatisation does not just provide avenues for selfish interests. 
We don't want to justify suspicion that the public firms were deliberately run down to make easy pickings for buccaneers. Kenya
